member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask.

remarks.para: The mask consists of a string that determines what class of character is acceptable at each input position.
Other characters are treated as literals.They are displayed in the control but cannotbe edited.
For example, the mask "000-0000" causes the control to accept only digits at every position except the third, which always contains a dash.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether new characters will be inserted or replace existing ones while you are typing.
member.remarks: Set this property value to true if typing characters should be inserted at an insertion point position; otherwise, set it to false if typing characters should overwrite existing characters at an insertion point position.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.Input.C1MaskedTextBox.MaskedTextChanged
member.summary: Occurs when consistent content that conforms to the changes in the text box.
member.remarks: Just after the Text property has beed changed via user input or code, the updates the text again in order to make it consistent with the . As a result, the TextChanged event can be triggered twice on each user input. In contrast to this, the is triggered only when Text is updated with a value that conforms to the .
